title: US 'spied on French presidents'
desc: The US National Security Agency spied on French Presidents Jacques Chirac Nicolas Sarkozy and Francois Hollande in 2006-12 the WikiLeaks website says.

title: Hungary suspends key EU asylum rule
desc: Hungary suspends a key EU rule that says it must take back asylum seekers who first enter Hungary but travel on to other countries.

title: World 'largely favours' US and Obama
desc: The US is viewed favourably by two-thirds of people surveyed by Pew in 40 countries up on previous years but its interrogation methods remain unpopular.

title: Armenians stage renewed protests
desc: Thousands of demonstrators in the Armenian capital Yerevan take part in renewed protests against rising electricity prices.

title: Rebel flag protests spread across US
desc: Four US states join South Carolina in calling on the withdrawal of the Confederate battle flag after a church shooting thought to be racially motivated.

title: Queen 'could move out of palace'
desc: The Queen may have to move out of Buckingham Palace temporarily to allow maintenance work costing £150m to be carried out royal officials say.

title: Police raid Toyota after arrest
desc: Police raid the offices of Toyota Motor after the arrest of Julie Hamp a senior American executive on alleged drug offences.

title: Ebola crisis 'harming malaria fight'
desc: The Ebola epidemic in Guinea that began early last year has set back the country's fight against malaria say experts.

title: Nigeria town hit by 'girl bomber'
desc: A girl aged about 12 is reported to have killed at least 10 people in a suicide attack in Nigeria's north-eastern Yobe state.

title: UK border pledge over Calais migrants
desc: Border security is stepped up in northern France and Dover after migrants desperate to reach the UK tried to exploit ferry strike action in Calais.

title: Mushroom 'helps keep fat off'
desc: A mushroom used for centuries in Chinese medicine reduces weight gain in animals say researchers in Taiwan.

title: Miami Dolphins owner 'in $8bn F1 bid'
desc: The owner of the Miami Dolphins American football team is reportedly working with investors from Qatar to buy a stake in Formula 1 racing.

desc: Many people in Calais who are attempting to enter the UK illegally are jumping on lorries which are stuck in queues due to a port workers strike.

desc: The task of managing China's turbulent change creates enormous pressures on the individuals involved.
